translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Kiṅkaṇi Flowers
The Elder Piyālaphaladāyaka’s Story
“In the past I was a hunter,
wandering in the forest then;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
who had gone beyond all things.

analyzed: piyāla phalam ādāya  buddha seṭṭhaḥ sadā saha
translated: Taking a piyāla fruit,🔽I always served the best Buddha;
I was confident with my hands
in the field of merit, the hero.
Thirty-one eons ago,
the fruit I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical insights,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Piyālaphaladāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā piyālaphaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Piyālaphaladāyakattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā piyālaphaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  piyālaphaladāyaka therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Elder Piyālaphaladāyaka’s Story is the tenth.
The fiftieth chapter is concluded.
The summary:
Kiṅkaṇī, paṁsukūla,
koraṇḍa, and then kiṁsuka;
The one with half the virtue, the one who killed,
The one who made a pond, the one who made a stūpa.
The one who made a mat, the ninth,
The one who gave a piyāla fruit;
One hundred and one verses,
And nine more than that.
Now the section summary:
The Metteyya section, Bhaddāli,🔽And the one who anointed himself once;
The one who lived alone, the Vibhītakī,
The one with the world, the Sāla flower.
The reed house, the rag-robe,
And the one with the Kiṅkiṇika flower;
Eighty-two verses,

analyzed: catuddasa satāni ca  metteyya vagga dasaka
translated: And one thousand four hundred.🔽The Metteyya section set of tens.
The fifth hundred is finished.
